+public class SyncStatus {

+  public UnsignedLong starting_slot;

nodes.bodyText: This needs to be in a synchronised block.  Both the read and write sides have to be synchronised for it to have any effect.

The currentSlot is already available from ChainStorageClient.getBestSlot() and that will correctly show the last imported block, not just the last downloaded block.
highestSlot probably should be calculated from SyncManager as well since it's the highest slot of any peer, not just the slot of the peer we're syncing to at the moment.
And then at that point you'd only have a single variable being updated here, so it could be volatile and remove all the synchronized.
We should be able to assert the exact highest slot as it should be the slot of the remote peer we set up.
Starting slot should be volatile since it's accessed from multiple threads.
Nit: UnsignedLong.ZERO - or even better if we can compare against the sync start slot as you suggested in chat...

Shouldn't we know the exact starting slot?  We setup the remote peer state and control when it responds with data, so it should be completely deterministic from what I can see (but there's a good chance I'm missing something)
I wouldn't have expected us to store this.  Just findBestSyncPeer in getSyncStatus so we ensure we have an up to date value regardless of which peer we are currently syncing to.
I don't think this needs to be synchronized.  Especially once we're not storing highestSlot but as it stands the write isn't synchronized so it's not thread safe anyway.
This should be private with accessors to follow standard java idiom.
